primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God restores His presence to humanity through the work of Christ (the Cornerstone), transforming believers into a collective temple (Living Stones) to manifest His glory.

tekstueel_bewijs: God decided not to leave us in this. He planned to rescue a race of people
God did not leave us to stew in our own juices. Instead, he had a plan
Jesus Christ... atoned for our sins once for all

object.identificatie: The Presence of God / Restoration of the Face-to-Face relationship
tekstueel_bewijs: The Bible says God created us for his presence.
Seeing him and knowing him face-to-face.
chosen by God and precious to him
He planned to rescue a race of people
now you are the people of God
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: Receiver (The hearer is the 'Living Stone' being built by God)

helper.identificatie: The Holy Spirit / The Community of Believers
tekstueel_bewijs: the Holy Spirit, comes into you
as you are fitted together with the other people around you
we wanted to be our own masters
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: Sin is described as an ontological break that makes the presence of God unbearable and destructive to the human condition.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The believer (Subject) offers spiritual sacrifices (Object) to the world/God as a response to their new identity.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Believer (as Priest)
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The sermon explicitly states that 'output' (secondary) is only possible because of 'input' (primary/soteriological).

voorbeelden_god_subject: God decided not to leave us.
voorbeelden_mens_subject: We wanted to be our own masters.
You have to relate to the cornerstone.

voorbeelden: What we are called to do.
Don’t you want to be part of that?
What does it all mean? Let’s break that down.
How we can be enabled and empowered to do it.
the power for change that you have within you.

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on the 'ability' (Pouvoir) granted by God rather than the 'obligation' (Devoir) of the law.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From S1 (Eden) to ~S1 (Fall), then acknowledging S2 (God's presence kills), moving to ~S2 (Christ as veil/cornerstone), returning to S1 (Temple/Glory).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Christ acts as the 'Cornerstone' that allows the Holy to inhabit the Unholy without destruction.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High; the sermon emphasizes that God's presence 'will destroy you' without Christ.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon maintains God as the primary actor in the 'Building' process and defines human action as a secondary 'output' necessitated by a prior 'input'.

indicatoren_moralisme.indicator: Focus on human effort in community
indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: If you’re only coming here and taking and you’re not giving... it’s bad for you.

indicatoren_genade.indicator: God as the initiator of the plan
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: God did not leave us to stew in our own juices.

indicatoren_genade.indicator: Identity based on being loved, not doing
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: The fact that you are loved in Jesus Christ becomes the foundation of your life.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Biblical figures like Moses and Abraham are used to show the progression of God's presence, not as moral templates to copy.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Theocentric: God revealed Himself to them episodically, but reveals Himself to us permanently.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and empowerment; the hearer is a 'stone' being placed by a Master Builder.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: Strong integration of the 'Temple' metaphor across biblical history and personal application.
spanning_punten: The tension between 'being built' (passive) and 'offering sacrifices' (active).

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: He was despised and rejected... because you were precious to him.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Severe; sin makes God's presence lethal.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully positions God as the Subject of the primary narrative (Salvation/Building) and the believer as the Subject of the secondary narrative (Service/Sacrifice).

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain current balance; it effectively counters moralism.
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Continue emphasizing that 'being built' is a passive verb.

tegenstander_intensivering.huidige_status: Strongly defined as the 'unbearable presence' due to sin.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: The sermon is a masterclass in avoiding moralism by grounding every 'call to action' in a 'call to receive' the work of the Cornerstone.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While rhetoric would focus on the 'Input/Output' metaphor, Greimas reveals that the 'Subject' of the building is God, preventing the metaphor from becoming a works-based demand.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains the 'Living Stone' text; semiotics shows how the sermon's structure mirrors the Gospel's deep grammar.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas highlights that the 'Opponent' is not just 'not serving,' but the 'lethality of the unmediated presence of God,' which necessitates a Divine Subject.

appendices.notities: The sermon uses the 'Cornerstone' as the pivot point for all modal competencies.
